results.title: Epinephrine-induced hypokalemia: the role of beta adrenoceptors.
results.text_hl: In a further study with a similar design another nonselective beta blocker @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@propranolol@@@ also increased @CHEMICAL_Potassium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011188 @@@potassium@@@ after @CHEMICAL_Epinephrine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004837 @@@epinephrine@@@. While @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ also prevented @<m>DISEASE_Hypokalemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007008 @@@hypokalemia@@@ in this study, it did not block the @GENE_BDKRB2 @GENE_624 @@@beta 2-receptor@@@ mediated decrease in diastolic BP.

citations.NLM: Reid JL, Whyte KF, Struthers AD. Epinephrine-induced hypokalemia: the role of beta adrenoceptors. Am J Cardiol. 1986 Apr 25;57(12):23F-27F. PMID: 3010693
citations.BibTeX: @article{3010693, title={Epinephrine-induced hypokalemia: the role of beta adrenoceptors.}, author={Reid JL and Whyte KF and Struthers AD}, journal={Am J Cardiol}, volume={57}, number={12}, pages={23F-27F}}

results.title: Comparison of the effects of cetamolol and atenolol on epinephrine- and isoproterenol-induced hypokalemia in anesthetized dogs.
results.text_hl: On the other hand, @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ could produce only partial blockade of @CHEMICAL_Epinephrine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D004837 @@@epinephrine@@@-induced @<m>DISEASE_Hypokalemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007008 @@@hypokalemia@@@ in a dose-related manner and had essentially no effect on @CHEMICAL_Isoproterenol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D007545 @@@isoproterenol@@@-induced @<m>DISEASE_Hypokalemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007008 @@@hypokalemia@@@.

citations.NLM: Klein M, Stupienski RF, Nettler S, Smith T, Oshiro G. Comparison of the effects of cetamolol and atenolol on epinephrine- and isoproterenol-induced hypokalemia in anesthetized dogs. J Cardiovasc Pharmacol. 1989 Jan;13(1):118-24. PMID: 2468922
citations.BibTeX: @article{2468922, title={Comparison of the effects of cetamolol and atenolol on epinephrine- and isoproterenol-induced hypokalemia in anesthetized dogs.}, author={Klein M and Stupienski RF and Nettler S and Smith T and Oshiro G}, journal={J Cardiovasc Pharmacol}, volume={13}, number={1}, pages={118-24}}

results.title: Liddle's syndrome: A case report.
results.text_hl: The @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@ was successfully treated with a high @CHEMICAL_Potassium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011188 @@@potassium@@@ diet, @CHEMICAL_Triamterene @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014223 @@@triamterene@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@. @DISEASE_Liddle_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:D056929 @@@Liddle's syndrome@@@ should be considered as the differential diagnosis in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ presenting with the clinical picture of @<m>DISEASE_Hypokalemia</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007008 @@@hypokalemia@@@, @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and low @GENE_REN @GENE_5972 @@@renin@@@/@CHEMICAL_Aldosterone @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000450 @@@aldosterone@@@ level.

citations.NLM: Patel P, Kuriacose R. Liddle's syndrome: A case report. Saudi J Kidney Dis Transpl. 2015 Jul-Aug;26(4):769-72. PMID: 26178554
citations.BibTeX: @article{26178554, title={Liddle's syndrome: A case report.}, author={Patel P and Kuriacose R}, journal={Saudi J Kidney Dis Transpl}, volume={26}, number={4}, pages={769-72}}
